newsitem.title: USA: Coastal drilling second south Texas well.
newsitem.headline: Coastal drilling second south Texas well.

text.p: Coastal Corp is drilling a twin well to assess a possible commercial natural gas discovery that sparked a land rush this year in south Texas, company executives said on Thursday.

The Houston-based energy company has drilled to 14,000 feet and plans to go as deep as 18,000 feet to test a reservoir that produced "inordinate pressures" in an initial well, Coastal President David Arledge said.
The well looks to be commercial, he told reporters after the company's annual meeting. He declined further comment until testing is completed.
"At this particular stage it still is an exploration project. It's not a development project," he said.
Word of the discovery in Wharton County about 60 miles southwest of Houston, which broke in a local newspaper, pushed prices up sharply for drilling rights in the region.
Coastal expects to lower its natural gas finding costs to $1.40 per thousand cubic feet (mcf) in 1997 from $1.60 mcf last year, Arledge said.
